posts.name: Pete Walters
posts.cooked:
Today, we’re releasing version 7.46 to beta. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group .

Release notes:

  • Now when you link your primary Signal device to a new Desktop or iPad, you can bring your chat history and your last 45 days of media with you. The transfer process is end-to-end encrypted, and completely optional. When it comes to making the choice about whether or not to leave the past behind, you’re left to your own devices.

Let us know about any issues you experience! Thank you for being a beta tester!

This beta release continues a new feature we’re ready to test: linked device history syncing! In short, we’re using an end-to-end encrypted, device-independent backup format to optionally sync message history to newly-linked devices. This is a feature we’re super excited to release and we know many of you have been waiting for. We released a test run of this feature for Android → Desktop linking before the holidays, and we’re now ready to open it up for iOS as well. (Please check out that forum post for more technical details and an FAQ!)

Specifically, with this beta you’ll be able to sync message history:

  1. From a primary iPhone to a special Desktop build you can download from the earlier forum post .
  2. From a primary iPhone or Android to an iPad.

NOTE: Testing this involves a new linking of the device. The special Desktop build can be installed side-by-side with your existing Desktops, but unfortunately due to technical limitations we can’t do the same on iPad; so, testing this requires deleting existing Signal data from your iPad (either via Settings → Account → Delete All Data or by reinstalling) and re-linking. Re-linking will restore your message history and last 30 days of media, but as this is a new feature, bugs may exist; please use appropriate caution before deciding to test.

If you decide to test, please post logs (and any issues you encounter either during or after the sync) here or on the original forum post ! They’re helpful both if there was an error and if it succeeded (so we can get a sense of things like performance).

Thank you, as always, for being beta testers. We couldn’t build these features without your help.

link_counts.title: Help us test desktop history syncing!

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.46.0.610-beta

45 new commits since 7.45.0.602-beta (+ 1 commit omitted):

Show commits

  • Bump version to 7.46 [1]

  • Suppress notifications while link'n'sync is going [2]

  • Fix inconsequential typo when sorting collisions [3]

  • Discard "backwards" status updates for messages [4]

  • Defensively limit skipped row ids for SQL query to 50 [5]

  • Make invalid names in a profile change update message a non-fatal error [6]

  • Add a delay between post-restore message indexing batches (#10527) [7]

  • Inline simple address methods with confusing names [8]

  • Remove unnecessary code to check for gv2 support [9]

  • Consolidate some MemberViewDelegate methods [10]

  • Remove RecipientPickerRecipientState [11]

  • Add variants of PIN reminder strings that confirm it was correct [12]

  • Retain group avatar URLs, even if the avatar data is missing [13]

  • Require device linking to go through the Linked Devices view [14]

  • Add two owsFailDebugs to group avatar fetching [15]

  • Require 100MB free in order to launch the app [16]

  • Add internal only settings page to query the database [17]

  • [RFC] Cancel link'n'sync if the user backgrounds the app [18]

  • Render most undownloadable attachments [19]

  • Use local font variable [20]

  • Drop frames instead of failing backup in prod [21]

  • Pipe up memoji from NSAttributedString attributes [22]

  • Check for a Signal-specific header in Groups 403 responses [23]

  • use recognizable log level names [24]

  • Wait for commitment fetch when uploading it [25]

  • Skip unregistered accounts when using Sender Keys [26]

  • Split the Link'n'Sync feature flags for export/import [27]

  • Pass through parameter value for forced [28]

  • Fix legacy syncing check [29]

  • Use shorter pre key rotation limit when testing [30]

  • Update to LibSignal v0.65.6 [31]

  • Update AuthorMergeHelper when importing [32]

  • Add timestamp to removed-user messages [33]

  • Fix protocol version for removed-user messages [34]

  • Consolidate checks for envelope/message timestamps [35]

  • Don’t sync transcripts for removed-user messages [36]

  • shrink NSObject OWS category [37]

  • remove NSObject OWS category [38]

  • remove NSDate OWS objc category [39]

  • Pass system HTTP proxy settings to libsignal [40]

  • Hide navigation bar on registration permissions screen [41]

  • Handle large videos shared to the Share Extension and pasted into text input [42]

  • Don’t use GSEs for group stories [43]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.49.4 [44]

  • Update translations [45]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-iOS 7.45.0.602-beta…7.46.0.610-beta

posts.name: Xashyar
posts.cooked:
Trouble re-linking iPad

Re-linking iPad consistently fails (Network failed error). I have already reported a related crash in the previous Beta feedback report:

Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.45 release iOS Beta Feedback
Signal-iOS crashes and asks you to re-register / re-link Signal after, tapping on "Advanced. Steps to reproduce: Go to Settings → Privacy → Advanced App self-closes https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.45.0/21cf0ec862a8dcc9d2eaaee83bfcdea83caaf2918d5e261e0d17c72e63fe5bc9.zip

I just linked an iPad, message and media transfer went perfectly well, no issues! Thank you for constantly improving our experience!

Beta testing for this release has concluded. If you find any further bugs related to this release or earlier releases, please report them on GitHub (read How to Report Bugs for more information on how to do that).

If you have feedback specifically related to the new beta version, please post it in the following topic: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.47 release.
